body_html: Unfortunately it's now part of the 1.0 API so we can't easily change it. It might be possible to validate the names of ops against the OpDef registry, which should catch some errors. Over time, however, I think we'll want to standardize on TF functions (which I guess are not yet part of the stable tf.* API) as the way to specify overridden gradients for subgraphs and individual ops.
body_text: Unfortunately it's now part of the 1.0 API so we can't easily change it. It might be possible to validate the names of ops against the OpDef registry, which should catch some errors. Over time, however, I think we'll want to standardize on TF functions (which I guess are not yet part of the stable tf.* API) as the way to specify overridden gradients for subgraphs and individual ops.
body: Unfortunately it's now part of the 1.0 API so we can't easily change it. It might be possible to validate the names of ops against the `OpDef` registry, which should catch some errors. Over time, however, I think we'll want to standardize on TF functions (which I guess are not yet part of the stable `tf.*` API) as the way to specify overridden gradients for subgraphs and individual ops.
